title: 1.4.2 Release
Display a list of document errors if all files fail to be indexed
body: Fixes #268

title: Fix the test server
body:
Problems:
- The feature was hidden behind a Cargo `feature` that didn't exist, so it was never being compiled in
- The feature was out of date and didn't compile as-is
- The demo webpage referenced old CDN assets
- The value of the `index_path` command line argument wasn't being extracted properly since I was querying it with the incorrect string `index`

Fixes #269

title: Convert all HashMap usage to BTreeMap
body:
Fixes #261 

```sh
❯ while TRUE; cargo run -- build --input local-dev/test-configs/federalist.toml --output test.st 2> /dev/null && sha256sum test.st; end
05ece8e36d4c1abc4362f3969c304288a26500a81df05d37f324ba709581e955  test.st
05ece8e36d4c1abc4362f3969c304288a26500a81df05d37f324ba709581e955  test.st
05ece8e36d4c1abc4362f3969c304288a26500a81df05d37f324ba709581e955  test.st
05ece8e36d4c1abc4362f3969c304288a26500a81df05d37f324ba709581e955  test.st
```

This is achieved by using a BTreeMap instead of a Hashmap in the Index data structure. This looks like it slows down build times a lot; I'm not sure what effect it has on search times.

Alternatively, I could only convert to a BTreeMap when it comes time to serialize, as described in https://stackoverflow.com/a/42723390 - let's see how metrics look first though.

title: Compensate for border radius when displaying progress bar
body: Closes #260

title: Add relative benchmarks in CI
Update versions to 1.4.1
Fix python script invocation
Fix path to upload script in the release GH action
Fix regression when reading from stdin
body: Closes #251

title: Merge all non-wasm and non-cli crates
body:
Splitting everything into many crates was a mistake. Now there are only three:

- stork-lib, containing shared code
- stork-wasm, containing WASM API wrapper
- stork-cli, for building indexes (primarily)

## Still to do

- [x] Test this architecture with the development webpage
- [x] Cache deserialized indexes in WASM cache instead of bags of bytes

title: Use the indexer's string split algorithm
body:
Fixes #236.

This is a hairy part of the code, and highlighting still isn't up to par, but this will at least stop the searcher from crashing as described in the issue.

title: Pin WASM to versioned CDN URL when generating JS build artifact
Add @easrng's Edible themes
body: Had to do a bit of building on top to integrate them into the rest of the theme architecture, add a changelog entry, set the files to be uploaded to the project CDN, etc.

title: Score results based on multiple excerpts' scores
body:
Balances multiple lower scores more evenly against a single high score.  

A result with multiple instances of a search result will be properly weighted higher than a result with a single instance.

title: Calm down builtin theme appearances
Don't unwrap u8 cast without providing default
Rename cli binary to `stork` from default `stork-cli`
body: Fixes #218

title: Fix crash when input includes words longer than 128 characters
body: Closes #227

title: Add new search result output format
body:
Also fixes the `--timing` flag

- [x] Add to changelog

title: Make all indexes buildable via justfile
body: Also fixes web scraping after modularization

title: Add changelog and update Readme
Accept JSON as possible config format
body: Closes #198

title: Remove console.log from attachToDom
Fix entityIsReady check
Modularize Rust codebase
Prepare for 1.3.0 release
Update version to 1.2.2
_Actually_ fixes the stdin block
body:
- Hadn't gotten all the instances where a stdin read was blocking
- I was also using the wrong method to read from stdin 🤦 
- I might just remove the stdin functionality altogether in 2.0.0

title: Only read stdin if requested from the command line option
body: Fixes #207

title: Use CSS Variables to power themes
body: Closes #177

title: Use Just to rebuild the Stork local development system
Allow user to configure result noun
body: Closes #75

title: When index is built with embedded anchors, use them when linking to search results
body:
Fixes #159 (cc @karlicoss)
Fixes #200 (cc @justinmeyer)

title: Update readme and issue templates
Add web-scraping feature

title: Bump ws from 7.3.1 to 7.5.5
body:
Bumps [ws](https://github.com/websockets/ws) from 7.3.1 to 7.5.5.
Release notes

Sourced from ws's releases.

7.5.5

Bug fixes

  • Backported ec9377ca to the 7.x release line (0e274acd).

7.5.4

Bug fixes

  • Backported 6a72da3e to the 7.x release line (76087fbf).
  • Backported 869c9892 to the 7.x release line (27997933).

7.5.3

Bug fixes

  • The WebSocketServer constructor now throws an error if more than one of the noServer, server, and port options are specefied (66e58d27).
  • Fixed a bug where a 'close' event was emitted by a WebSocketServer before the internal HTTP/S server was actually closed (5a587304).
  • Fixed a bug that allowed WebSocket connections to be established after WebSocketServer.prototype.close() was called (772236a1).

7.5.2

Bug fixes

  • The opening handshake is now aborted if the client receives a Sec-WebSocket-Extensions header but no extension was requested or if the server indicates an extension not requested by the client (aca94c86).

7.5.1

Bug fixes

  • Fixed an issue that prevented the connection from being closed properly if an error occurred simultaneously on both peers (b434b9f1).

7.5.0

Features

  • Some errors now have a code property describing the specific type of error that has occurred (#1901).

Bug fixes

  • A close frame is now sent to the remote peer if an error (such as a data framing error) occurs (8806aa9a).
  • The close code is now always 1006 if no close frame is received, even if the connection is closed due to an error (8806aa9a).

7.4.6

Bug fixes

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 2d968a6 [dist] 7.5.5
  • ab5fcd6 [doc] Change label text to CI
  • aa21e70 [ci] Use Github Actions for Windows x86 testing
  • e519810 [pkg] Update eslint-plugin-prettier to version 4.0.0
  • 0e274ac [minor] Skip unnecessary operations if the socket is already closed
  • 075752d [dist] 7.5.4
  • 2799793 [fix] Resume the socket in the next tick
  • 76087fb [fix] Do not rely on undocumented behavior
  • 4c1849a [dist] 7.5.3
  • 772236a [fix] Abort the handshake if the server is closing or closed
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=ws&package-manager=npm_and_yarn&previous-version=7.3.1&new-version=7.5.5)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. title: Extract alt text from images; add "skip HTML" feature
body:
Closes #148 and closes #186 by replacing the HTML parsing library to one that gives me more control over what part of an HTML page I'm looking at.

Starts foundational work for #159 (in that we can retrieve nearest-ID data now), but to close that issue still requires some JS changes to actually link to those IDs.

body:
Bumps [y18n](https://github.com/yargs/y18n) from 4.0.0 to 4.0.1.
Changelog

Sourced from y18n's changelog.

Change Log

All notable changes to this project will be documented in this file. See standard-version for commit guidelines.

5.0.5 (2020-10-25)

Bug Fixes

  • address prototype pollution issue (#108) (a9ac604)

5.0.4 (2020-10-16)

Bug Fixes

  • exports: node 13.0 and 13.1 require the dotted object form with a string fallback (#105) (4f85d80)

5.0.3 (2020-10-16)

Bug Fixes

  • exports: node 13.0-13.6 require a string fallback (#103) (e39921e)

5.0.2 (2020-10-01)

Bug Fixes

  • deno: update types for deno ^1.4.0 (#100) (3834d9a)

5.0.1 (2020-09-05)

Bug Fixes

  • main had old index path (#98) (124f7b0)

5.0.0 (2020-09-05)

⚠ BREAKING CHANGES

  • exports maps are now used, which modifies import behavior.
  • drops Node 6 and 4. begin following Node.js LTS schedule (#89)

Features

  • add support for ESM and Deno #95) (4d7ae94)

... (truncated)

title: Add debug method to JS interface
body: for debugging the state of the JS module while it's on the page!

title: Use Clap crate to parse command line commands
body:
Also:
- Fix a bunch of pedantic clippy lints
- Use colored crate to make command line output nicer
- Add `break_on_file_error` config
- Deprecate `filename` in output config

My PR hygiene wasn't very good here. There's lots to test... I should come back and write more tests for all the small behavior changes I introduced here.

title: Bump elliptic from 6.5.3 to 6.5.4
body:
Bumps [elliptic](https://github.com/indutny/elliptic) from 6.5.3 to 6.5.4.
Commits
  • 43ac7f2 6.5.4
  • f4bc72b package: bump deps
  • 441b742 ec: validate that a point before deriving keys
  • e71b2d9 lib: relint using eslint
  • 8421a01 build(deps): bump elliptic from 6.4.1 to 6.5.3 (#231)
  • See full diff in compare view

You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot use these labels` will set the current labels as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these reviewers` will set the current reviewers as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use these assignees` will set the current assignees as the default for future PRs for this repo and language - `@dependabot use this milestone` will set the current milestone as the default for future PRs for this repo and language You can disable automated security fix PRs for this repo from the [Security Alerts page](https://github.com/jameslittle230/stork/network/alerts).

title: Remove inaccurate "optimal"
body: Hosting js files locally is not any slower compared to CDNs and may be even faster because all modern browsers separate caches by domain.

title: Use semantic HTML for search highlight
body:
Use the `<mark>` tag to highlight the search result, to increase semantics. 
See https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Element/mark#usage_notes second bullet point.

title: If src_url is missing from file, assume value is url field instead
body:
Now, the config file can look like:

```toml
[input]
html_selector = "main > article.post > .single__content"

[[input.files]]
url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/from-zoom-hangouts-to-soup-cans-bowdoins-crew-team-gets-creative-during-social-distancing/"
title = "From Zoom hangouts to soup cans: Bowdoin’s crew team gets creative during social distancing"

[[input.files]]
url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/pond-hockey-until-watson-opens-womens-hockey-stays-focused-on-virtual-team-bonding/"
title = "Pond hockey: until Watson opens women’s hockey stays focused on virtual team bonding"

[[input.files]]
url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/embracing-technology-and-social-media-bowdoin-athletics-masters-new-tools-for-recruiting/"
title = "Embracing technology and social media, Bowdoin athletics masters new tools for recruiting"
```

instead of

```toml
[input]
html_selector = "main > article.post > .single__content"

[[input.files]]
src_url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/from-zoom-hangouts-to-soup-cans-bowdoins-crew-team-gets-creative-during-social-distancing/"
url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/from-zoom-hangouts-to-soup-cans-bowdoins-crew-team-gets-creative-during-social-distancing/"
title = "From Zoom hangouts to soup cans: Bowdoin’s crew team gets creative during social distancing"

[[input.files]]
src_url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/pond-hockey-until-watson-opens-womens-hockey-stays-focused-on-virtual-team-bonding/"
url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/pond-hockey-until-watson-opens-womens-hockey-stays-focused-on-virtual-team-bonding/"
title = "Pond hockey: until Watson opens women’s hockey stays focused on virtual team bonding"

[[input.files]]
src_url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/embracing-technology-and-social-media-bowdoin-athletics-masters-new-tools-for-recruiting/"
url = "https://bowdoinorient.com/2021/02/19/embracing-technology-and-social-media-bowdoin-athletics-masters-new-tools-for-recruiting/"
title = "Embracing technology and social media, Bowdoin athletics masters new tools for recruiting"
```

title: Fix JS idempotency bugs (by rearchitecting the module)
Fix build script so it works on fresh clone
Improve build stats script
body: Rewrite stats script to run benchmarks via `cargo criterion` and output JSON, fixing up a launchtime pain point.

title: Index content from the web
body:
I've been working on this on [Twitch](https://twitch.tv/jameslittle230)! This feature will probably go out in 1.2.0.

Closes #11
